Classical.Structure: Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex. Uppermost part of the prefrontal cortex.
Classical.Function: Core component of the Central Executive Network (CEN). Responsible for working memory, cognitive flexibility, planning, and abstract reasoning.
Classical.Pathology: Dysexecutive syndrome, working memory deficits, schizophrenia.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A key node in the brain's macroscopic quantum entanglement network (Central Executive Network). Its function is dependent on the global proton-spin entanglement (W > 1) that collapses during unconsciousness.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'conscious workspace' of the mind. The architect that takes information and builds coherent plans and strategies.

Falsification_Hypotheses: The DLPFC will show no loss of its quantum entanglement signature (W > 1) during general anesthesia, even as executive function ceases.
Working memory tasks will show no correlation with the brain's global entanglement factor.
Experimental_Protocols: Advanced MQC-NMR (Kerskens, 2024) to measure the entanglement witness (W) in the CEN during a high-load working memory task.
